abstract: The third-quarter loss came as growing numbers of consumer loans soured and the bank paid millions of dollars to wean itself off government life support.
snippet: The third-quarter loss came as growing numbers of consumer loans soured and the bank paid millions of dollars to wean itself off government life support.
lead_paragraph: After two taxpayer bailouts, Bank of America is still struggling to stand on its own.

headline.main: Burdened by Defaults, Bank of America Misses Forecast
headline.print_headline: Credit Card Defaults Push Bank of America to a Loss

byline.original: By Jack Healy and Louise Story

abstract: Bank of America said Friday that it lost $1 billion for the third quarter, as the banking giant continues to struggle with credit losses and indigestion from its purchase of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: Bank of America said Friday that it lost $1 billion for the third quarter, as the banking giant continues to struggle with credit losses and indigestion from its purchase of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: Update | 7:27 a.m. After reporting big profits over the last six months, Bank of America lost $1 billion in the third quarter as growing numbers of consumer loans soured and the bank paid millions of dollars to wean itself off government life support.

headline.main: Bank of America Lost $1 Billion in 3rd Quarter

abstract: Wall Street lost ground after a bigger-than-expected loss at Bank of America and a weak report from General Electric.
snippet: Wall Street lost ground after a bigger-than-expected loss at Bank of America and a weak report from General Electric.
lead_paragraph: On Wednesday, a blockbuster profit at the banking giant JPMorgan Chase sent the Dow Jones industrial average above 10,000 for the first time in a year.

headline.main: Dow Slips Back Below 10,000 After Earnings Reports Disappoint
headline.print_headline: Dow Slips Back Below 10,000 After Earnings Reports Disappoint

abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, the outgoing chief executive of Bank of America, said Friday that the bank’s credit losses from the financial crisis may have finally peaked, but he cautioned that the fourth quarter would remain challenging as the economy is expected to sour.
snippet: Kenneth D. Lewis, the outgoing chief executive of Bank of America, said Friday that the bank’s credit losses from the financial crisis may have finally peaked, but he cautioned that the fourth quarter would remain challenging as the economy is exp...
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the departing chief executive of Bank of America, said Friday that the bank’s credit losses from the financial crisis might have finally peaked, but he cautioned that the fourth quarter would remain challenging.

headline.main: Lewis Says BofA’s Credit Losses May Have Peaked

abstract: Deal Professors Steven Davidoff and Peter Henning mull over the potential dilemma facing Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz after Bank of America agreed to waive its attorney-client privilege for documents related to its Merrill Lynch deal.
snippet: Deal Professors Steven Davidoff and Peter Henning mull over the potential dilemma facing Wachtell, Lipton, Rosen & Katz after Bank of America agreed to waive its attorney-client privilege for documents related to its Merrill Lynch deal.
lead_paragraph: This post is by Steven M. Davidoff and Peter Henning, a professor at Wayne State Law School and an occasional guest blogger for the Deal Professor.

headline.main: In Bank of America Mess, What About Wachtell?
